Has anyone in your state public health agency led, funded, or supported a Health Impact Assessment (HIA) training in the past two years? For the purposes of this question, a Health Impact Assessment is defined as “a combination of procedures, methods, and tools by which a policy, program, or project may be judged as to its potential effects on the health of a population, and the distribution of those effects within the population” (1999 Gothenburg consensus statement).
Has anyone in your state public health agency led, funded, or supported a Health Impact Assessment (HIA) in the past two years?
How many HIAs has your state public health agency led, funded, or supported in the past two years?

Does your state public health agency participate in an HIA Advisory Committee? HIA Advisory Committee is an interdisciplinary leadership group established in the scoping phase of the HIA (or existing from previous HIAs) that sets parameters and directs the development and implementation of the HIA. This group makes decisions related to indicators, priorities, etc. and can act as champions during the reporting phase

Does your state/territorial health agency have a formal performance management program in place that includes ALL of the following: performance standards, performance measures, reporting of progress, and a quality improvement process?
Which of the following statements best characterizes your SHA’s current quality improvement activities?
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?  Agency QI Council or other committee that coordinates QI efforts

Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?  Staff Member with dedicated time as part of their job description to monitor QI work throughout the agency
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA? Agency-wide QI Plan
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA? Agency performance data is used on a ongoing basis to drive improvement efforts
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?  Leadership dedicates resources (e.g., time, funding) to QI
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?  QI is incorporated in employee job descriptions
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?  QI is incorporated in employee performance appraisals
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?   QI resources and training opportunities are offered to staff on an ongoing basis
Which of the following elements of a formal agency-wide QI program are currently in place at your SHA?   None of the above
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts?  We provide training to staff in QI methods
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts?   We recognize outstanding QI work with employee recognition award(s)
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts? Participation in QI efforts is included as part of employee performance goals
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts? We provide monetary incentives
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts? Quality improvement is included in job descriptions for some employees
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts? We have formed a QI committee that coordinates QI efforts
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts? We provide funding to support QI efforts
In what ways does your agency support or encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts? We do not actively encourage staff involvement in quality improvement efforts
